task_summary: The robot locates, grasps, and places a pot into the sink as observed in the 9 contact sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: A robotic manipulator in a compact kitchen workspace must move a pot from a location in front of the sink onto and into the sink. The workspace contains a stovetop, sink, and the pot is initially placed on the counter. The robot must visually locate the pot, approach, grasp, move to the sink area, and place the pot there with an appropriate release. Observed constraints: workspace tightness, direct placement.
preconditions: Pot is present on the countertop and visible.
Sink is accessible to the robot.
stepwise_plan: Locate the pot using visual feedback, retrying if necessary.
Approach above the pot, open gripper, compute suitable grasp.
Close gripper to grasp the pot and verify stable grasp.
Locate the sink, move above it.
Lower and place pot into the sink area.
success_criteria: Pot is fully released and resting inside the sink.
Gripper is empty and clear of the sink.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect pot or sink – retry up to 3 times with scanning.
Grasp failure – abort and signal error.
task_long_description.termination: Sequence finishes upon gripper release and retreat after placing the pot inside the sink.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: place the pot in the sink

node_specs.description: Checks if the pot is visible to the perception system.
Scans workspace for pot using a raster pattern; used if initial detection fails.
Runs direct detection for the pot.
Opens the gripper to 0.08m before grasping or releasing.
Moves end-effector above the pot for grasping preparation.
Computes a top grasp pose for the pot, stores in blackboard.
Aligns and approaches the pot ready for grasping.
Lowers until gentle contact is detected with the pot.
Closes the gripper around the pot using low force.
Checks if the grasp is stable.
Checks if the sink is visible.
Detects the sink if not immediately visible.
Moves above the sink to prepare for placement.
Places the pot in the sink with light downward force.
Opens the gripper to release the pot after placement.
Retracts the end-effector away from the sink area.

failure_modes: Unsuccessful grasp or loss during transfer
recovery_strategy: Perception nodes use retry via scanning fallback for both pot and sink
Abort and alert human if grasp or placement fails after retries
assumptions: Frames indicate direct transfer (no intermediate holding or pausing phases).
Pot is grasped from above with a top grasp as required by geometry.
Placing is a direct action with no rotational alignment required.
No instruction/frames conflict detected; phases inferred strictly from image sequence.

expected_success_criteria: Pot fully clear of gripper, resting inside sink after sequence
No collisions or object loss during transfer
